# The RemoteResponse Object
### Description
The `RemoteResponse` object is used to represent information returned from a third-party endpoint.

### Usage Example
View the `RemoteResponse` returned from your `DataPassthrough`.

user_name.description: The User's full name at the time of this Event occurring.

user_email.description: The User's email at the time of this Event occurring.

allOf.description:
* `ADMIN` - ADMIN
* `DEVELOPER` - DEVELOPER
* `MEMBER` - MEMBER
* `API` - API
* `SYSTEM` - SYSTEM
* `MERGE_TEAM` - MERGE_TEAM

role.description:
Designates the role of the user (or SYSTEM/API if action not taken by a user) at the time of this Event occurring.

* `ADMIN` - ADMIN
* `DEVELOPER` - DEVELOPER
* `MEMBER` - MEMBER
* `API` - API
* `SYSTEM` - SYSTEM
* `MERGE_TEAM` - MERGE_TEAM

items.description:
# The ModelOperation Object
### Description
The `ModelOperation` object is used to represent the operations that are currently supported for a given model.

### Usage Example
View what operations are supported for the `Candidate` endpoint.

# The BankInfo Object
### Description
The `BankInfo` object is used to represent the Bank Account information for an Employee.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST BankInfo` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all bank information.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

employee.description: The employee with this bank account.

account_type.description:
The bank account type

* `SAVINGS` - SAVINGS
* `CHECKING` - CHECKING

remote_created_at.description: When the matching bank object was created in the third party system.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The Benefit Object
### Description
The `Benefit` object is used to represent a benefit that an employee has enrolled in.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Benefits` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all benefits.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

provider_name.description: The name of the benefit provider.

start_date.description: The day and time the benefit started.

end_date.description: The day and time the benefit ended.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

employer_benefit.description: The employer benefit plan the employee is enrolled in.

items.description:
# The Dependent Object
### Description
The `Dependent` object is used to represent a dependent (e.g. child, spouse, domestic partner, etc) of an `Employee`

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Dependents` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all dependents.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

relationship.description:
The dependent's relationship to the employee.

* `CHILD` - CHILD
* `SPOUSE` - SPOUSE
* `DOMESTIC_PARTNER` - DOMESTIC_PARTNER

employee.description: The employee this person is a dependent of.

gender.description:
The dependent's gender.

* `MALE` - MALE
* `FEMALE` - FEMALE
* `NON-BINARY` - NON-BINARY
* `OTHER` - OTHER
* `PREFER_NOT_TO_DISCLOSE` - PREFER_NOT_TO_DISCLOSE

is_student.description: Whether or not the dependent is a student

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The EmployeePayrollRun Object
### Description
The `EmployeePayrollRun` object is used to represent an employee's pay statement for a specific payroll run.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST EmployeePayrollRun` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all employee payroll runs.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

employee.description: The employee whose payroll is being run.

gross_pay.description: The total earnings throughout a given period for an employee before any deductions are made.

net_pay.description: The take-home pay throughout a given period for an employee after deductions are made.

start_date.description: The day and time the payroll run started.

end_date.description: The day and time the payroll run ended.

check_date.description: The day and time the payroll run was checked.

items.description:
# The Earning Object
### Description
The `Earning` object is used to represent an array of different compensations that an employee receives within specific wage categories.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Earnings` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all earnings.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

type.description:
The type of earning.

* `SALARY` - SALARY
* `REIMBURSEMENT` - REIMBURSEMENT
* `OVERTIME` - OVERTIME
* `BONUS` - BONUS

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The Deduction Object
### Description
The `Deduction` object is used to represent an array of the wages withheld from total earnings for the purpose of paying taxes.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Deductions` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all deductions.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

employee_deduction.description: The amount of money that is withheld from an employee's gross pay by the employee.

company_deduction.description: The amount of money that is withheld on behalf of an employee by the company.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The Tax Object
### Description
The `Tax` object is used to represent an array of the tax deductions for a given employee's payroll run.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Taxes` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all taxes.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

employer_tax.description: Whether or not the employer is responsible for paying the tax.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.
Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The Employee Object
### Description
The `Employee` object is used to represent any person who has been employed by a company.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Employee` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all employees.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

employee_number.description: The employee's number that appears in the third-party integration's UI.

company.description: The ID of the employee's company.

display_full_name.description: The employee's full name, to use for display purposes. If a preferred first name is available, the full name will include the preferred first name.

username.description: The employee's username that appears in the remote UI.

employments.description: Array of `Employment` IDs for this Employee.

manager.description: The employee ID of the employee's manager.

gender.description:
The employee's gender.

* `MALE` - MALE
* `FEMALE` - FEMALE
* `NON-BINARY` - NON-BINARY
* `OTHER` - OTHER
* `PREFER_NOT_TO_DISCLOSE` - PREFER_NOT_TO_DISCLOSE

allOf.description:
* `AMERICAN_INDIAN_OR_ALASKA_NATIVE` - AMERICAN_INDIAN_OR_ALASKA_NATIVE
* `ASIAN_OR_INDIAN_SUBCONTINENT` - ASIAN_OR_INDIAN_SUBCONTINENT
* `BLACK_OR_AFRICAN_AMERICAN` - BLACK_OR_AFRICAN_AMERICAN
* `HISPANIC_OR_LATINO` - HISPANIC_OR_LATINO
* `NATIVE_HAWAIIAN_OR_OTHER_PACIFIC_ISLANDER` - NATIVE_HAWAIIAN_OR_OTHER_PACIFIC_ISLANDER
* `TWO_OR_MORE_RACES` - TWO_OR_MORE_RACES
* `WHITE` - WHITE
* `PREFER_NOT_TO_DISCLOSE` - PREFER_NOT_TO_DISCLOSE

ethnicity.description:
The employee's ethnicity.

* `AMERICAN_INDIAN_OR_ALASKA_NATIVE` - AMERICAN_INDIAN_OR_ALASKA_NATIVE
* `ASIAN_OR_INDIAN_SUBCONTINENT` - ASIAN_OR_INDIAN_SUBCONTINENT
* `BLACK_OR_AFRICAN_AMERICAN` - BLACK_OR_AFRICAN_AMERICAN
* `HISPANIC_OR_LATINO` - HISPANIC_OR_LATINO
* `NATIVE_HAWAIIAN_OR_OTHER_PACIFIC_ISLANDER` - NATIVE_HAWAIIAN_OR_OTHER_PACIFIC_ISLANDER
* `TWO_OR_MORE_RACES` - TWO_OR_MORE_RACES
* `WHITE` - WHITE
* `PREFER_NOT_TO_DISCLOSE` - PREFER_NOT_TO_DISCLOSE

marital_status.description:
The employee's filing status as related to marital status.

* `SINGLE` - SINGLE
* `MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY` - MARRIED_FILING_JOINTLY
* `MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY` - MARRIED_FILING_SEPARATELY
* `HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD` - HEAD_OF_HOUSEHOLD
* `QUALIFYING_WIDOW_OR_WIDOWER_WITH_DEPENDENT_CHILD` - QUALIFYING_WIDOW_OR_WIDOWER_WITH_DEPENDENT_CHILD

hire_date.description: The date that the employee was hired, usually the day that an offer letter is signed. If an employee has multiple hire dates from previous employments, this represents the most recent hire date. Note: If you're looking for the employee's start date, refer to the start_date field.

start_date.description: The date that the employee started working. If an employee was rehired, the most recent start date will be returned.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's employee was created.

employment_status.description:
The employment status of the employee.

* `ACTIVE` - ACTIVE
* `PENDING` - PENDING
* `INACTIVE` - INACTIVE

avatar.description: The URL of the employee's avatar image.

custom_fields.description: Custom fields configured for a given model.

response_format.description:
# The Employee Object
### Description
The `Employee` object is used to represent any person who has been employed by a company.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Employee` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all employees.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

employee_number.description: The employee's number that appears in the third-party integration's UI.

company.description: The ID of the employee's company.

display_full_name.description: The employee's full name, to use for display purposes. If a preferred first name is available, the full name will include the preferred first name.

username.description: The employee's username that appears in the remote UI.

employments.description: Array of `Employment` IDs for this Employee.

manager.description: The employee ID of the employee's manager.

gender.description:
The employee's gender.

* `MALE` - MALE
* `FEMALE` - FEMALE
* `NON-BINARY` - NON-BINARY
* `OTHER` - OTHER
* `PREFER_NOT_TO_DISCLOSE` - PREFER_NOT_TO_DISCLOSE

hire_date.description: The date that the employee was hired, usually the day that an offer letter is signed. If an employee has multiple hire dates from previous employments, this represents the most recent hire date. Note: If you're looking for the employee's start date, refer to the start_date field.

start_date.description: The date that the employee started working. If an employee was rehired, the most recent start date will be returned.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's employee was created.

employment_status.description:
The employment status of the employee.

* `ACTIVE` - ACTIVE
* `PENDING` - PENDING
* `INACTIVE` - INACTIVE

items.description:
# The EmployerBenefit Object
### Description
The `Employer Benefit` object is used to represent a benefit plan offered by a company.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST EmployerBenefits` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all EmployerBenefits.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

benefit_plan_type.description:
The type of benefit plan.

* `MEDICAL` - MEDICAL
* `HEALTH_SAVINGS` - HEALTH_SAVINGS
* `INSURANCE` - INSURANCE
* `RETIREMENT` - RETIREMENT
* `OTHER` - OTHER

name.description: The employer benefit's name - typically the carrier or network name.

description.example: HDHP Silver Plan

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description: The full data pulled from the third-party API for an object.

# The Employment Object
### Description
The `Employment` object is used to represent a job position at a company.

Please note: When there is a change in pay or title, integrations with historical data will create new Employment objects while integrations without historical data will update existing ones.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Employments` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all employees.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

response_format.description:
# The Employment Object
### Description
The `Employment` object is used to represent a job position at a company.

Please note: When there is a change in pay or title, integrations with historical data will create new Employment objects while integrations without historical data will update existing ones.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Employments` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all employees.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

pay_rate.description: The position's pay rate in dollars.

items.description:
# The Group Object
### Description
The `Group` object is used to represent any subset of employees across, for example, `DEPARTMENT` or `TEAM`. Employees can be in multiple Groups.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Employee` endpoint and expand groups to view an employee's groups.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

parent_group.description: The parent group for this group.

type.description:
The Group type returned directly from the third-party.

* `TEAM` - TEAM
* `DEPARTMENT` - DEPARTMENT
* `COST_CENTER` - COST_CENTER
* `BUSINESS_UNIT` - BUSINESS_UNIT
* `GROUP` - GROUP

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The LinkedAccount Object
### Description
The `LinkedAccount` object is used to represent an end user's link with a specific integration.

### Usage Example
View a list of your organization's `LinkedAccount` objects.

is_duplicate.description: Whether a Production Linked Account's credentials match another existing Production Linked Account. This field is `null` for Test Linked Accounts, incomplete Production Linked Accounts, and ignored duplicate Production Linked Account sets.

# The ModelOperation Object
### Description
The `ModelOperation` object is used to represent the operations that are currently supported for a given model.

### Usage Example
View what operations are supported for the `Candidate` endpoint.

items.description:
# The Location Object
### Description
The `Location` object is used to represent an address that can be associated with an employee.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Locations` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all office locations.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

street_1.description: Line 1 of the location's street address.

street_2.description: Line 2 of the location's street address.

state.description: The location's state. Represents a region if outside of the US.

zip_code.description: The location's zip code or postal code.

response_format.description:
# The Location Object
### Description
The `Location` object is used to represent an address that can be associated with an employee.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Locations` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all office locations.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

street_1.description: Line 1 of the location's street address.

street_2.description: Line 2 of the location's street address.

state.description: The location's state. Represents a region if outside of the US.

zip_code.description: The location's zip code or postal code.

items.description:
# The PayGroup Object
### Description
The `PayGroup` object is used to represent a subset of employees that are put together for payroll processing purposes.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST PayGroup` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all pay group information.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The PayrollRun Object
### Description
The `PayrollRun` object is used to represent a group of pay statements for a specific pay schedule.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST PayrollRuns` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all payroll runs.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

run_state.description:
The state of the payroll run

* `PAID` - PAID
* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `APPROVED` - APPROVED
* `FAILED` - FAILED
* `CLOSED` - CLOSED

run_type.description:
The type of the payroll run

* `REGULAR` - REGULAR
* `OFF_CYCLE` - OFF_CYCLE
* `CORRECTION` - CORRECTION
* `TERMINATION` - TERMINATION
* `SIGN_ON_BONUS` - SIGN_ON_BONUS

start_date.description: The day and time the payroll run started.

end_date.description: The day and time the payroll run ended.

check_date.description: The day and time the payroll run was checked.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

# The TimeOff Object
### Description
The `TimeOff` object is used to represent all employees' Time Off entries.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST TimeOffs` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all time off requests.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

approver.description: The Merge ID of the employee with the ability to approve the time off request.

status.description:
The status of this time off request.

* `REQUESTED` - REQUESTED
* `APPROVED` - APPROVED
* `DECLINED` - DECLINED
* `CANCELLED` - CANCELLED
* `DELETED` - DELETED

employee_note.description: The employee note for this time off request.
employee_note.example: Moving into the new apartment Kendall Roy gave me!

units.description:
The measurement that the third-party integration uses to count time requested.

* `HOURS` - HOURS
* `DAYS` - DAYS

amount.description: The time off quantity measured by the prescribed “units”.

allOf.description:
* `VACATION` - VACATION
* `SICK` - SICK
* `PERSONAL` - PERSONAL
* `JURY_DUTY` - JURY_DUTY
* `VOLUNTEER` - VOLUNTEER
* `BEREAVEMENT` - BEREAVEMENT

request_type.description:

* `PERSONAL` - PERSONAL
* `JURY_DUTY` - JURY_DUTY
* `VOLUNTEER` - VOLUNTEER
* `BEREAVEMENT` - BEREAVEMENT

start_time.description: The day and time of the start of the time requested off.

end_time.description: The day and time of the end of the time requested off.

items.description:
# The Candidate Object
### Description
The `Candidate` object is used to represent profile information about a given Candidate. Because it is specific to a Candidate, this information stays constant across applications.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Candidates` endpoint and filter by `ID` to show all candidates.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The candidate's current company.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's candidate was created.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's candidate was updated.

last_interaction_at.description: When the most recent interaction with the candidate occurred.

is_private.description: Whether or not the candidate is private.

can_email.description: Whether or not the candidate can be emailed.

items.description: The candidate's locations.

### Description
The `PhoneNumber` object is used to represent a candidate's phone number.

The type of phone number.

* `HOME` - HOME

* `SKYPE` - SKYPE
* `OTHER` - OTHER

items.description:
# The ScheduledInterview Object
### Description
The `ScheduledInterview` object is used to represent a scheduled interview for a given candidate’s application to a job. An `Application` can have multiple `ScheduledInterview`s depending on the particular hiring process.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST ScheduledInterviews` endpoint and filter by `interviewers` to show all office locations.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's interview was created.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's interview was updated.

status.description:
The interview's status.

* `SCHEDULED` - SCHEDULED
* `AWAITING_FEEDBACK` - AWAITING_FEEDBACK
* `COMPLETE` - COMPLETE

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The JobInterviewStage Object
### Description
The `JobInterviewStage` object is used to represent a particular recruiting stage for an `Application`. A given `Application` typically has the `JobInterviewStage` object represented in the current_stage field.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST JobInterviewStages` endpoint and view the job interview stages used by a company.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

name.description: Standard stage names are offered by ATS systems but can be modified by users.

job.description: This field is populated only if the stage is specific to a particular job. If the stage is generic, this field will not be populated.

stage_order.description: The stage’s order, with the lowest values ordered first. If the third-party does not return details on the order of stages, this field will not be populated.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The Job Object
### Description
The `Job` object can be used to track any jobs that are currently or will be open/closed for applications.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Jobs` endpoint to show all job postings.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

name.example: Software Engineer (Merge is actually hiring btw)

description.example: If you're reading this documentation, you might be a good fit for Merge!

code.description: The job's code. Typically an additional identifier used to reference the particular job that is displayed on the ATS.

status.description:
The job's status.

* `OPEN` - OPEN
* `CLOSED` - CLOSED
* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `ARCHIVED` - ARCHIVED
* `PENDING` - PENDING

type.description:
The job's type.

* `POSTING` - POSTING
* `REQUISITION` - REQUISITION
* `PROFILE` - PROFILE

job_postings.description: IDs of `JobPosting` objects that serve as job postings for this `Job`.

# The User Object
### Description
The `User` object is used to represent a user in the remote system.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET /api/mktg/v1/users` endpoint and view their email addresses.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

role.description:
The user's role.

* `ADMIN` - ADMIN
* `MANAGER` - MANAGER
* `CONTRIBUTOR` - CONTRIBUTOR
* `VIEWER` - VIEWER

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The Account Object
### Description
An `Account` represents a category in a company’s ledger in which a financial transaction is recorded against. The aggregation of each `Account` object is often referred to as the **Chart of Accounts**.

An `Account` can be classified into one of the following categories, determined through the `classification` field:
* __Asset:__ Accounts Receivable and Bank Accounts
* __Liability:__ Accounts Payable and Credit Card Accounts
* __Equity:__ Treasury Accounts and Retained Earnings
* __Revenue:__ Income and Other Income
* __Expense:__ Cost of Goods Sold and Office Expenses

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Accounts` endpoint and view a company's accounts.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

description.example: Cash

classification.description:
The account's broadest grouping.

* `ASSET` - ASSET
* `EQUITY` - EQUITY
* `EXPENSE` - EXPENSE
* `LIABILITY` - LIABILITY
* `REVENUE` - REVENUE

type.description: The account's type is a narrower and more specific grouping within the account's classification.

status.description:
The account's status.

* `ACTIVE` - ACTIVE
* `PENDING` - PENDING
* `INACTIVE` - INACTIVE

company.description: The company the account belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

x-merge-model-tooltip.title: Looking for __Bank Accounts__?
x-merge-model-tooltip.content: Bank Accounts are represented as an __Account__ with a `classification` of __ASSET__.

response_format.description:
# The Account Object
### Description
An `Account` represents a category in a company’s ledger in which a financial transaction is recorded against. The aggregation of each `Account` object is often referred to as the **Chart of Accounts**.

An `Account` can be classified into one of the following categories, determined through the `classification` field:
* __Asset:__ Accounts Receivable and Bank Accounts
* __Liability:__ Accounts Payable and Credit Card Accounts
* __Equity:__ Treasury Accounts and Retained Earnings
* __Revenue:__ Income and Other Income
* __Expense:__ Cost of Goods Sold and Office Expenses

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Accounts` endpoint and view a company's accounts.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

description.example: Cash

classification.description:
The account's broadest grouping.

* `ASSET` - ASSET
* `EQUITY` - EQUITY
* `EXPENSE` - EXPENSE
* `LIABILITY` - LIABILITY
* `REVENUE` - REVENUE

type.description: The account's type is a narrower and more specific grouping within the account's classification.

status.description:
The account's status.

* `ACTIVE` - ACTIVE
* `PENDING` - PENDING
* `INACTIVE` - INACTIVE

items.description:
# The Contact Object
### Description
The `Contact` object is used to represent a contact in the remote system.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET /api/mktg/v1/contact` endpoint and view their phone numbers.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

items.description:
# The Role Object
### Description
The `Role` object is used to represent the set of actions & access that a user with this role is allowed to perform.

### Usage Example
TODO

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

allOf.description:
* `VIEW` - VIEW
* `CREATE` - CREATE
* `EDIT` - EDIT
* `DELETE` - DELETE
* `CLOSE` - CLOSE
* `ASSIGN` - ASSIGN

ticket_actions.description: The set of actions that a User with this Role can perform. Possible enum values include: `VIEW`, `CREATE`, `EDIT`, `DELETE`, `CLOSE`, and `ASSIGN`.

ticket_access.description:
The level of Ticket access that a User with this Role can perform.

* `ALL` - ALL
* `ASSIGNED_ONLY` - ASSIGNED_ONLY
* `TEAM_ONLY` - TEAM_ONLY

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The Ticket Object
### Description
The `Ticket` object is used to represent a ticket or a task within a system.

### Usage Example
TODO

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

creator.description: The user who created this ticket.

status.description:
The current status of the ticket.

* `OPEN` - OPEN
* `CLOSED` - CLOSED
* `IN_PROGRESS` - IN_PROGRESS
* `ON_HOLD` - ON_HOLD

description.description: The ticket’s description. HTML version of description is mapped if supported by the third-party platform.
description.example: Can you please add more integrations? It'll make syncing data much easier!

ticket_type.description: The sub category of the ticket within the 3rd party system. Examples include incident, task, subtask or to-do.

account.description: The account associated with the ticket.

contact.description: The contact associated with the ticket.

items.description: The tag's name.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's ticket was created.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's ticket was updated.

ticket_url.description: The 3rd party url of the Ticket.

priority.description:
The priority or urgency of the Ticket.

* `URGENT` - URGENT
* `HIGH` - HIGH
* `NORMAL` - NORMAL
* `LOW` - LOW

field_type.description:
* `string` - string
* `number` - number
* `date` - date
* `datetime` - datetime
* `bool` - bool
* `list` - list

items.description:
# The AccountingPeriod Object
### Description
The `AccountingPeriod` object is used to define a period of time in which events occurred.

### Usage Example
Common models like `Invoice` and `Transaction` will have `AccountingPeriod` objects which will denote when they occurred.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

items.description:
# The BalanceSheet Object
### Description
The `BalanceSheet` object shows a company’s assets, liabilities, and equity. Assets should be equal to liability and equity combined. This shows the company’s financial health at a specific point in time.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST BalanceSheets` endpoint and view a company's balance sheets.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: `Company` object for the given `BalanceSheet` object.

date.description: The balance sheet's date. The balance sheet data will reflect the company's financial position this point in time.

items.description:
# The ReportItem Object
### Description
The `ReportItem` object is used to represent a report item for a Balance Sheet, Cash Flow Statement or Profit and Loss Report.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET BalanceSheet` endpoint and view the balance sheet's report items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the report item belongs to.

response_format.description:
# The BalanceSheet Object
### Description
The `BalanceSheet` object shows a company’s assets, liabilities, and equity. Assets should be equal to liability and equity combined. This shows the company’s financial health at a specific point in time.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST BalanceSheets` endpoint and view a company's balance sheets.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: `Company` object for the given `BalanceSheet` object.

date.description: The balance sheet's date. The balance sheet data will reflect the company's financial position this point in time.

items.description:
# The ReportItem Object
### Description
The `ReportItem` object is used to represent a report item for a Balance Sheet, Cash Flow Statement or Profit and Loss Report.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET BalanceSheet` endpoint and view the balance sheet's report items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the report item belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The CashFlowStatement Object
### Description
The `CashFlowStatement` object shows operating activities, investing activities, and financing activities over a period of time (month, quarter, or year).

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST CashFlowStatements` endpoint and view a company's cash flow statements.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the cash flow statement belongs to.

start_period.description: The cash flow statement's start period.

end_period.description: The cash flow statement's end period.

cash_at_beginning_of_period.description: Cash and cash equivalents at the beginning of the cash flow statement's period.

cash_at_end_of_period.description: Cash and cash equivalents at the beginning of the cash flow statement's period.

items.description:
# The ReportItem Object
### Description
The `ReportItem` object is used to represent a report item for a Balance Sheet, Cash Flow Statement or Profit and Loss Report.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET BalanceSheet` endpoint and view the balance sheet's report items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the report item belongs to.

response_format.description:
# The CashFlowStatement Object
### Description
The `CashFlowStatement` object shows operating activities, investing activities, and financing activities over a period of time (month, quarter, or year).

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST CashFlowStatements` endpoint and view a company's cash flow statements.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the cash flow statement belongs to.

start_period.description: The cash flow statement's start period.

end_period.description: The cash flow statement's end period.

cash_at_beginning_of_period.description: Cash and cash equivalents at the beginning of the cash flow statement's period.

cash_at_end_of_period.description: Cash and cash equivalents at the beginning of the cash flow statement's period.

items.description:
# The ReportItem Object
### Description
The `ReportItem` object is used to represent a report item for a Balance Sheet, Cash Flow Statement or Profit and Loss Report.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET BalanceSheet` endpoint and view the balance sheet's report items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the report item belongs to.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the report item belongs to.

remote_generated_at.description: The time that cash flow statement was generated by the accounting system.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The CompanyInfo Object
### Description
The `CompanyInfo` object contains information about the company of the linked account. If the company has multiple entities (also known as subsidiaries), each entity may show up as a single `CompanyInfo` record.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET CompanyInfo` endpoint and view a company's information.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

fiscal_year_end_month.description: The company's fiscal year end month.

fiscal_year_end_day.description: The company's fiscal year end day.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's company was created.

items.description: The url.

# The Address Object
### Description
The `Address` object is used to represent a contact's or company's address.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET CompanyInfo` endpoint and view the company's addresses.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

type.description:

* `BILLING` - BILLING
* `SHIPPING` - SHIPPING

items.description:
# The AccountingPhoneNumber Object
### Description
The `AccountingPhoneNumber` object is used to represent a contact's or company's phone number.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET CompanyInfo` endpoint and view the company's phone numbers.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

type.description: The phone number's type.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

response_format.description:
# The CompanyInfo Object
### Description
The `CompanyInfo` object contains information about the company of the linked account. If the company has multiple entities (also known as subsidiaries), each entity may show up as a single `CompanyInfo` record.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET CompanyInfo` endpoint and view a company's information.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

fiscal_year_end_month.description: The company's fiscal year end month.

fiscal_year_end_day.description: The company's fiscal year end day.

The `Address` object is used to represent a contact's or company's address.

items.description:
# The AccountingPhoneNumber Object
### Description
The `AccountingPhoneNumber` object is used to represent a contact's or company's phone number.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET CompanyInfo` endpoint and view the company's phone numbers.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

type.description: The phone number's type.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The CreditNote Object
### Description
A `CreditNote` is transaction issued to a customer, indicating a reduction or cancellation of the amount owed by the customer. It is most generally used as an adjustment note used to rectify errors, returns, or overpayments related to a sales transaction. A `CreditNote` can be applied to *Accounts Receivable* Invoices to decrease the overall amount of the Invoice.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST CreditNotes` endpoint and view a company's credit notes.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

status.description:
The credit note's status.

* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `AUTHORIZED` - AUTHORIZED
* `PAID` - PAID

company.description: The company the credit note belongs to.

remaining_credit.description: The amount of value remaining in the credit note that the customer can use.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

name.description: The credit note line item's name.

description.description: The description of the item that is owed.
description.example: prorated amount for items

quantity.description: The credit note line item's quantity.

memo.description: The credit note line item's memo.

unit_price.description: The credit note line item's unit price.

tax_rate.description: The credit note line item's tax rate.

total_line_amount.description: The credit note line item's total.

tracking_category.description: The credit note line item's associated tracking category.

tracking_categories.description: The credit note line item's associated tracking categories.

account.description: The credit note line item's account.

company.description: The company the credit note belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's credit note was created.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's credit note was updated.

applied_payments.description: A list of the Payment Applied to Lines common models related to a given Invoice, Credit Note, or Journal Entry.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the CreditNote was generated in.

response_format.description:
# The CreditNote Object
### Description
A `CreditNote` is transaction issued to a customer, indicating a reduction or cancellation of the amount owed by the customer. It is most generally used as an adjustment note used to rectify errors, returns, or overpayments related to a sales transaction. A `CreditNote` can be applied to *Accounts Receivable* Invoices to decrease the overall amount of the Invoice.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST CreditNotes` endpoint and view a company's credit notes.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

status.description:
The credit note's status.

* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `AUTHORIZED` - AUTHORIZED
* `PAID` - PAID

company.description: The company the credit note belongs to.

remaining_credit.description: The amount of value remaining in the credit note that the customer can use.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

name.description: The credit note line item's name.

description.description: The description of the item that is owed.
description.example: prorated amount for items

quantity.description: The credit note line item's quantity.

memo.description: The credit note line item's memo.

unit_price.description: The credit note line item's unit price.

tax_rate.description: The credit note line item's tax rate.

total_line_amount.description: The credit note line item's total.

tracking_category.description: The credit note line item's associated tracking category.

tracking_categories.description: The credit note line item's associated tracking categories.

account.description: The credit note line item's account.

company.description: The company the credit note belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's credit note was created.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's credit note was updated.

applied_payments.description: A list of the Payment Applied to Lines common models related to a given Invoice, Credit Note, or Journal Entry.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the CreditNote was generated in.

items.description:
# The Expense Object
### Description
The `Expense` object is used to represent a direct purchase by a business, typically made with a check, credit card, or cash. Each `Expense` object is dedicated to a grouping of expenses, with each expense recorded in the lines object.

The `Expense` object is used also used to represent refunds to direct purchases. Refunds can be distinguished from purchases by the amount sign of the records. Expense objects with a negative amount are purchases and `Expense` objects with a positive amount are refunds to those purchases.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Expense` endpoint and view a company's expense.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

remote_created_at.description: When the expense was created.

sub_total.description: The expense's total amount before tax.

items.description:
# The ExpenseLine Object
### Description
The `ExpenseLine` object is used to represent an expense's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Expense` endpoint and view the expense's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the line belongs to.

response_format.description:
# The Expense Object
### Description
The `Expense` object is used to represent a direct purchase by a business, typically made with a check, credit card, or cash. Each `Expense` object is dedicated to a grouping of expenses, with each expense recorded in the lines object.

The `Expense` object is used also used to represent refunds to direct purchases. Refunds can be distinguished from purchases by the amount sign of the records. Expense objects with a negative amount are purchases and `Expense` objects with a positive amount are refunds to those purchases.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Expense` endpoint and view a company's expense.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

remote_created_at.description: When the expense was created.

sub_total.description: The expense's total amount before tax.

items.description:
# The ExpenseLine Object
### Description
The `ExpenseLine` object is used to represent an expense's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Expense` endpoint and view the expense's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the line belongs to.

items.description:
# The IncomeStatement Object
### Description
The `IncomeStatement` object is used to represent a company’s income, the cost of sales, operating expenses, and other non-operating expenses. The object also includes other important values like gross profit, gross operating profit, and net income. This represents a period of time (month, quarter, or year).

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET IncomeStatement` endpoint and view a company's income statement for a given period.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

items.description:
# The ReportItem Object
### Description
The `ReportItem` object is used to represent a report item for a Balance Sheet, Cash Flow Statement or Profit and Loss Report.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET BalanceSheet` endpoint and view the balance sheet's report items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the report item belongs to.

response_format.description:
# The IncomeStatement Object
### Description
The `IncomeStatement` object is used to represent a company’s income, the cost of sales, operating expenses, and other non-operating expenses. The object also includes other important values like gross profit, gross operating profit, and net income. This represents a period of time (month, quarter, or year).

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET IncomeStatement` endpoint and view a company's income statement for a given period.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the income statement belongs to.

items.description:
# The ReportItem Object
### Description
The `ReportItem` object is used to represent a report item for a Balance Sheet, Cash Flow Statement or Profit and Loss Report.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET BalanceSheet` endpoint and view the balance sheet's report items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the report item belongs to.

# The ReportItem Object
### Description

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET BalanceSheet` endpoint and view the balance sheet's report items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the report item belongs to.

net_income.description: The gross profit minus the total expenses.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The Invoice Object
### Description
The `Invoice` object represents an itemized record of goods and/or services sold to a customer.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Invoices` endpoint and view a company's invoices.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

type.description:
Whether the invoice is an accounts receivable or accounts payable. If `type` is `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE`, the invoice is a bill. If `type` is `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE`, it is an invoice.

* `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE` - ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE
* `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE` - ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE

company.description: The company the invoice belongs to.

status.description:
The status of the invoice.

* `PAID` - PAID
* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `PARTIALLY_PAID` - PARTIALLY_PAID
* `OPEN` - OPEN

total_tax_amount.description: The total amount being paid in taxes.

applied_payments.description: A list of the Payment Applied to Lines common models related to a given Invoice, Credit Note, or Journal Entry.

items.description:
# The InvoiceLineItem Object
### Description
The `InvoiceLineItem` object represents an itemized record of goods and/or services sold to a customer.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Invoice` endpoint and view the invoice's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

description.example: Pickleball lessons

company.description: The company the line item belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the Invoice was generated in.

response_format.description:
# The Invoice Object
### Description
The `Invoice` object represents an itemized record of goods and/or services sold to a customer.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Invoices` endpoint and view a company's invoices.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

type.description:
Whether the invoice is an accounts receivable or accounts payable. If `type` is `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE`, the invoice is a bill. If `type` is `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE`, it is an invoice.

* `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE` - ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE
* `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE` - ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE

company.description: The company the invoice belongs to.

status.description:
The status of the invoice.

* `PAID` - PAID
* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `PARTIALLY_PAID` - PARTIALLY_PAID
* `OPEN` - OPEN
* `VOID` - VOID

total_tax_amount.description: The total amount being paid in taxes.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's invoice entry was updated.

applied_payments.description: A list of the Payment Applied to Lines common models related to a given Invoice, Credit Note, or Journal Entry.

items.description:
# The InvoiceLineItem Object
### Description
The `InvoiceLineItem` object represents an itemized record of goods and/or services sold to a customer.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Invoice` endpoint and view the invoice's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

description.example: Pickleball lessons

items.description:
# The Item Object
### Description
The `Item` object refers to the goods involved in a transaction.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Items` endpoint and view a company's items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

status.description:
The item's status.

* `ACTIVE` - ACTIVE
* `ARCHIVED` - ARCHIVED

purchase_price.description: The price at which the item is purchased from a vendor.

purchase_account.description: References the default account used to record a purchase of the item.

sales_account.description: References the default account used to record a sale.

company.description: The company the item belongs to.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's item note was updated.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The JournalEntry Object
### Description
A `JournalEntry` is a record of a transaction or event that is entered into a company's accounting system.

The `JournalEntry` common model contains records that are automatically created as a result of a certain type of transaction, like an Invoice, and records that are manually created against a company’s ledger.

The lines of a given `JournalEntry` object should always sum to 0. A positive `net_amount` means the line represents a debit and a negative net_amount represents a credit.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET JournalEntry` endpoint and view a company's journey entry.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's journal entry was created.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's journal entry was updated.

applied_payments.description: A list of the Payment Applied to Lines common models related to a given Invoice, Credit Note, or Journal Entry.

company.description: The company the journal entry belongs to.

items.description:
# The JournalLine Object
### Description
The `JournalLine` object is used to represent a journal entry's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET JournalEntry` endpoint and view the journal entry's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

net_amount.description: The value of the line item including taxes and other fees.

company.description: The company the journal entry belongs to.

description.example: Cash payment for lunch

exchange_rate.description: The journal line item's exchange rate.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

journal_number.description: Reference number for identifying journal entries.

posting_status.description:
The journal's posting status.

* `UNPOSTED` - UNPOSTED
* `POSTED` - POSTED

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the JournalEntry was generated in.

response_format.description:
# The JournalEntry Object
### Description
A `JournalEntry` is a record of a transaction or event that is entered into a company's accounting system.

The `JournalEntry` common model contains records that are automatically created as a result of a certain type of transaction, like an Invoice, and records that are manually created against a company’s ledger.

The lines of a given `JournalEntry` object should always sum to 0. A positive `net_amount` means the line represents a debit and a negative net_amount represents a credit.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET JournalEntry` endpoint and view a company's journey entry.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's journal entry was created.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's journal entry was updated.

applied_payments.description: A list of the Payment Applied to Lines common models related to a given Invoice, Credit Note, or Journal Entry.

company.description: The company the journal entry belongs to.

items.description:
# The JournalLine Object
### Description
The `JournalLine` object is used to represent a journal entry's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET JournalEntry` endpoint and view the journal entry's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

net_amount.description: The value of the line item including taxes and other fees.

items.description:
# The Payment Object
### Description
The `Payment` object represents general payments made towards a specific transaction.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Payment` endpoint and view an invoice's payment.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

contact.description: The supplier, or customer involved in the payment.

account.description: The supplier’s or customer’s account in which the payment is made.

company.description: The company the payment belongs to.

total_amount.description: The total amount of money being paid to the supplier, or customer, after taxes.

type.description:
The type of the invoice.

* `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE` - ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE
* `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE` - ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's payment entry was updated.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the Payment was generated in.

items.description:
# The PaymentLineItem Object
### Description
The `PaymentLineItem` object is an applied-to-line on a `Payment` that can either be a `Invoice`, `CreditNote`, or `JournalEntry`.

### Usage Example
`Payment` will have a field called `applied-to-lines` which will be an array of `PaymentLineItemInternalMappingSerializer` objects that can either be a `Invoice`, `CreditNote`, or `JournalEntry`.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

applied_amount.description: The amount being applied to the transaction.

applied_date.description: The date the payment portion is applied.

related_object_id.description: The Merge ID of the transaction the payment portion is being applied to.

related_object_type.description: The type of transaction the payment portion is being applied to. Possible values include: INVOICE, JOURNAL_ENTRY, or CREDIT_NOTE.

applied_to_lines.description: A list of “Payment Applied to Lines” objects.

response_format.description:
# The Payment Object
### Description
The `Payment` object represents general payments made towards a specific transaction.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Payment` endpoint and view an invoice's payment.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

contact.description: The supplier, or customer involved in the payment.

account.description: The supplier’s or customer’s account in which the payment is made.

company.description: The company the payment belongs to.

total_amount.description: The total amount of money being paid to the supplier, or customer, after taxes.

type.description:
The type of the invoice.

* `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE` - ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE
* `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE` - ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's payment entry was updated.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the Payment was generated in.

items.description:
# The PaymentLineItem Object
### Description
The `PaymentLineItem` object is an applied-to-line on a `Payment` that can either be a `Invoice`, `CreditNote`, or `JournalEntry`.

### Usage Example
`Payment` will have a field called `applied-to-lines` which will be an array of `PaymentLineItemInternalMappingSerializer` objects that can either be a `Invoice`, `CreditNote`, or `JournalEntry`.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

applied_amount.description: The amount being applied to the transaction.

applied_date.description: The date the payment portion is applied.

related_object_id.description: The Merge ID of the transaction the payment portion is being applied to.

related_object_type.description: The type of transaction the payment portion is being applied to. Possible values include: INVOICE, JOURNAL_ENTRY, or CREDIT_NOTE.

applied_to_lines.description: A list of “Payment Applied to Lines” objects.

response_format.description:
# The AccountingPhoneNumber Object
### Description
The `AccountingPhoneNumber` object is used to represent a contact's or company's phone number.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET CompanyInfo` endpoint and view the company's phone numbers.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

type.description: The phone number's type.

items.description:
# The PurchaseOrder Object
### Description
A `PurchaseOrder` represents a request to purchase goods or services from a vendor. It outlines the details of the purchase, such as the items or services requested, quantities, prices, and delivery details.

A `PurchaseOrder` is a crucial component of the procurement process, but does not typically result in any impact on the company’s general ledger. The general ledger is typically only affected when the `PurchaseOrder` is fulfilled as an *Accounts Payable* Invoice object.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST PurchaseOrders` endpoint and view a company's purchase orders.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

status.description:
The purchase order's status.

* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `AUTHORIZED` - AUTHORIZED
* `BILLED` - BILLED
* `DELETED` - DELETED

purchase_order_number.description: The human-readable number of the purchase order.

customer.description: The contact making the purchase order.

vendor.description: The party fulfilling the purchase order.

memo.description: A memo attached to the purchase order.

company.description: The company the purchase order belongs to.

items.description:
# The PurchaseOrderLineItem Object
### Description
The `PurchaseOrderLineItem` object is used to represent a purchase order's line item.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET PurchaseOrder` endpoint and view a company's purchase orders.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

description.description: A description of the good being purchased.
description.example: Pickleball paddles

account.description: The purchase order line item's account.

tracking_category.description: The purchase order line item's associated tracking category.

tracking_categories.description: The purchase order line item's associated tracking categories.

tax_amount.description: The purchase order line item's tax amount.

total_line_amount.description: The purchase order line item's total amount.

exchange_rate.description: The purchase order line item's exchange rate.

company.description: The company the purchase order line item belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's purchase order note was created.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's purchase order note was updated.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the PurchaseOrder was generated in.

response_format.description:
# The PurchaseOrder Object
### Description
A `PurchaseOrder` represents a request to purchase goods or services from a vendor. It outlines the details of the purchase, such as the items or services requested, quantities, prices, and delivery details.

A `PurchaseOrder` is a crucial component of the procurement process, but does not typically result in any impact on the company’s general ledger. The general ledger is typically only affected when the `PurchaseOrder` is fulfilled as an *Accounts Payable* Invoice object.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST PurchaseOrders` endpoint and view a company's purchase orders.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

status.description:
The purchase order's status.

* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `AUTHORIZED` - AUTHORIZED
* `BILLED` - BILLED

items.description:
# The PurchaseOrderLineItem Object
### Description
The `PurchaseOrderLineItem` object is used to represent a purchase order's line item.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET PurchaseOrder` endpoint and view a company's purchase orders.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

description.description: A description of the good being purchased.
description.example: Pickleball paddles

account.description: The purchase order line item's account.

tracking_category.description: The purchase order line item's associated tracking category.

tracking_categories.description: The purchase order line item's associated tracking categories.

tax_amount.description: The purchase order line item's tax amount.

total_line_amount.description: The purchase order line item's total amount.

items.description:
# The TaxRate Object
### Description
The `TaxRate` object is used to represent a tax rate.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST TaxRates` endpoint and view tax rates relevant to a company.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

description.example: Sales Tax

total_tax_rate.description: The tax rate's total tax rate.

effective_tax_rate.description: The tax rate's effective tax rate.

company.description: The company the tax rate belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The TrackingCategory Object
### Description
A `TrackingCategory` object represents a categorization method used to classify transactions within an accounting platform. They are often used to group records for reporting and analysis purposes. The most common types of `TrackingCategories` are Classes and Departments.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET TrackingCategory` endpoint and view a company's tracking category.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

status.description:
The tracking category's status.

* `ACTIVE` - ACTIVE
* `ARCHIVED` - ARCHIVED

category_type.description:
The tracking category’s type.

* `CLASS` - CLASS
* `DEPARTMENT` - DEPARTMENT

parent_category.description: ID of the parent tracking category.

company.description: The company the tracking category belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The Transaction Object
### Description
The `Transaction` common model includes records of all types of transactions that do not appear in other common models. The type of transaction can be identified through the type field. More specifically, it will contain all types of transactions outside of:
* __Credit Notes__
* __Expenses__
* __Invoices__
* __Journal Entries__
* __Payments__
* __Purchase Orders__
* __Vendor Credits__

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Transaction` endpoint and view a company's transactions.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

transaction_type.description: The type of transaction, which can by any transaction object not already included in Merge’s common model.

number.description: The transaction's number used for identifying purposes.

transaction_date.description: The date upon which the transaction occurred.

contact.description: The contact to whom the transaction relates to.

total_amount.description: The total amount being paid after taxes.

company.description: The company the transaction belongs to.

items.description:
# The TransactionLineItem Object
### Description
The `TransactionLineItem` object is used to represent a transaction's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET TransactionLineItem` endpoint and view the transaction's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

memo.description: An internal note used by the business to clarify purpose of the transaction.

company.description: The company the line belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.
Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the Transaction was generated in.

x-merge-model-tooltip.content: A positive `net_amount` means the line represents a debit and a negative `net_amount` represents a credit.

response_format.description:
# The Transaction Object
### Description
The `Transaction` common model includes records of all types of transactions that do not appear in other common models. The type of transaction can be identified through the type field. More specifically, it will contain all types of transactions outside of:
* __Credit Notes__
* __Expenses__
* __Invoices__
* __Journal Entries__
* __Payments__
* __Purchase Orders__
* __Vendor Credits__

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Transaction` endpoint and view a company's transactions.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

transaction_type.description: The type of transaction, which can by any transaction object not already included in Merge’s common model.

number.description: The transaction's number used for identifying purposes.

transaction_date.description: The date upon which the transaction occurred.

contact.description: The contact to whom the transaction relates to.

total_amount.description: The total amount being paid after taxes.

company.description: The company the transaction belongs to.

items.description:
# The TransactionLineItem Object
### Description
The `TransactionLineItem` object is used to represent a transaction's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET TransactionLineItem` endpoint and view the transaction's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

memo.description: An internal note used by the business to clarify purpose of the transaction.
