company.description: The company the line belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.
Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the Transaction was generated in.

x-merge-model-tooltip.content: A positive `net_amount` means the line represents a debit and a negative `net_amount` represents a credit.

items.description:
# The VendorCredit Object
### Description
A `VendorCredit` is transaction issued by a vendor to the accounting company, indicating a reduction or cancellation of the amount owed to the vendor. It is most generally used as an adjustment note used to rectify errors, returns, or overpayments related to a purchasing transaction. A `VendorCredit` can be applied to *Accounts Payable* Invoices to decrease the overall amount of the Invoice.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET VendorCredit` endpoint and view a company's vendor credits.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

vendor.description: The vendor that owes the gift or refund.

company.description: The company the vendor credit belongs to.

items.description:
# The VendorCreditLine Object
### Description
The `VendorCreditLine` object is used to represent a vendor credit's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET VendorCredit` endpoint and view the vendor credit's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

net_amount.description: The full value of the credit.

description.example: Gifted Merge Credit

company.description: The company the line belongs to.

exchange_rate.description: The vendor credit line item's exchange rate.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.
Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the VendorCredit was generated in.

response_format.description:
# The VendorCredit Object
### Description
A `VendorCredit` is transaction issued by a vendor to the accounting company, indicating a reduction or cancellation of the amount owed to the vendor. It is most generally used as an adjustment note used to rectify errors, returns, or overpayments related to a purchasing transaction. A `VendorCredit` can be applied to *Accounts Payable* Invoices to decrease the overall amount of the Invoice.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET VendorCredit` endpoint and view a company's vendor credits.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

vendor.description: The vendor that owes the gift or refund.

company.description: The company the vendor credit belongs to.

items.description:
# The VendorCreditLine Object
### Description
The `VendorCreditLine` object is used to represent a vendor credit's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET VendorCredit` endpoint and view the vendor credit's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

net_amount.description: The full value of the credit.

description.example: Gifted Merge Credit

company.description: The company the line belongs to.

exchange_rate.description: The vendor credit line item's exchange rate.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.
Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the VendorCredit was generated in.

items.description:
# The Action Object
### Description
The `Action` object is used to represent an action executed within an automation.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET /api/mktg/v1/actions` endpoint and view their types.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

emails.description: The marketing emails sent by this action.

messages.description: The messages sent by this action.

type.description:
The action's type.

* `EMAIL` - EMAIL
* `MESSAGE` - MESSAGE

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description: The full data pulled from the third-party API for an object.

items.description:
# The Automation Object
### Description
The `Automation` object is used to represent an automation, workflow or custom event in the remote system.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET /api/mktg/v1/automations` endpoint and view their automation_trigger configurations.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

trigger_type.description:
The trigger type for running this automation.

* `TRIGGER_EVENT` - TRIGGER_EVENT
* `RECURRENCE` - RECURRENCE

description.example: This sends a welcome email to new customers.

status.description: The automation's status.

automation_trigger.description: The trigger configuraton for the automation.

actions.description: The actions performed by this automation.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description: The full data pulled from the third-party API for an object.

# The Contact Object
### Description
The `Contact` object is used to represent a contact in the remote system.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET /api/mktg/v1/contact` endpoint and view their phone numbers.

# The Campaign Object
### Description
The `Campaign` object is used to represent a marketing campaign in the remote system.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET /api/mktg/v1/campaigns` endpoint and view their unique opens.

# The Marketing Email Object
### Description
The `MarketingEmail` object is used to represent a marketing email in the remote system.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET /api/mktg/v1/emails` endpoint and view their html_body properties.

remote_created_at.description: When the contact was created in the remote system.

remote_updated_at.description: When the contact was last updated in the remote system.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The Event Object
### Description
The `Event` object is used to represent a marketing event, such as a webinar or email, in the remote system.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET /api/mktg/v1/events` endpoint and view their type properties.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

description.example: Webinar for new customers to learn more about the product.

remote_created_at.description: When the event was created in the remote system.

emails.description: The marketing emails about this event.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

items.description:
# The Contact Object
### Description
The `Contact` object is used to represent a contact in the remote system.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET /api/mktg/v1/contact` endpoint and view their phone numbers.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

items.description:
# The List Object
### Description
The `List` object is used to represent a list of contacts in the remote system.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET /api/mktg/v1/lists` endpoint and view their names.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

# The Contact Object

items.description:
# The Message Object
### Description
The `Message` object is used to represent a text message, in-app message or a message sent via another channel in the remote system.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET /api/mktg/v1/messages` endpoint and view their body properties.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

items.description:
# The Template Object
### Description
The `Template` object is used to represent a template for a marketing asset in the remote system.
### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET /api/mktg/v1/templates` endpoint and view their content properties.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

type.description:
The template's type.

* `EMAIL` - EMAIL
* `MESSAGE` - MESSAGE

contents.example: Welcome onboard! Stay connected and find out more.

remote_created_at.description: When the template was created in the remote system.

remote_updated_at.description: When the template was last updated in the remote system.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.
